name: Tracy00.GitHub.io
body:
##tracy
Guys, I'm Shubham and as of now I'm doing electronics from BITS Pilani. I'm interested in programming, signal processing, books and movies and i also do Robotics and philosophical stuffs in free time. Oh yes I blog too, sometimes. :P
I will be mostly writing about my projects and labs here and sometimes maybe reviews of other interesting stuffs.



#Mup Lab 7 tuesday 4-6
Q:Write  an  ALP  that 
r
eads  the  first 
character
of  the  file  abc.txt  (
available
on 
the  site  itself).  If  the 
character
is
in caps  it  converts  it to  small  letters  and 
displays,
it.  If  the
character
is  a  small  lette
r  it 
converts it to caps and 
displays,
it. If the 
character
read is a special 
character
or numeral it just 
displays,
it.

**Solution:**
>.model tiny

>.data

>fname	db 'abc.txt',0

>handle	dw ?

>dat1	db	5 dup('$')

>.code

>.startup

;open the file

>mov ah,3dh

>mov al,0

>lea dx,fname

>int 21h

>mov handle,ax

;read it

>mov ah,3fh

>mov bx,handle

>mov cx,1

>lea dx,dat1

>int 21h

;check

>lea si,dat1

>mov bl,[si]

>cmp bl,5ah

>jle x1

;small to caps

>sub bl,20h

>cmp ax,ax

>je	x2

>x1:	cmp bl,39h

>	jle x2

;caps to small	

>	add bl,20h

;display	

>x2:	mov dl,bl

>	mov ah,02h

>	int 21h

;close the file

>mov ah,3eh

>mov bx, handle

>int 21h

>.exit

>end

#Mup Lab 7 tuesday 2-4
Q:Write an ALP that takes in user key press one by one until enter key (ODH) is pressed. The characters
entered by the user must be stored in a file zyx.txt. The file is not already present; it has to be created.
You can assume that user will not enter more than 100 characters (this is only for reserving storage
space)

**Solution:**
>.model tiny

>.486

>.data

>max1 	db 100

>act1 	db ?

>inp1 	db 100 dup('$')

>fname	db 'hex.txt',0

>handle	dw ?

>.code

>.startup

;enter text

>lea dx,max1

>mov ah,0ah

>int 21h

;create file

>mov ah,3ch

>lea dx,fname

>mov cl,2

>int 21h

>mov handle,ax


>lea si,act1

>mov al,[si]

>and al,0fh

;write to the file

>mov ah,40h

>mov bx,handle

>movzx cx,al

>lea dx,inp1

>int 21h

;close the file

>mov ah,3eh

>mov bx, handle

>int 21h

>.exit

>end
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
